subject: Re: [junit] Remote debugging a JUNIT test case
msgSnippet: Well a bit more /scouring/ of the Internet along with some /trial and error/ and I have eventually arrived :-) Here is how it is done. I launch the test case
messageBody:
Well a bit more /scouring/ of the Internet along with some /trial and error/
and I have eventually arrived :-)

Here is how it is done. I launch the test case with the JAVA debugger
options and make sure to set the suspend option to yes. This way it waits
for the debugger to make the connection before executing the test. I use a
script to search for the test case and set the classpath.

java -Xdebug -Xnoagent
-Djava.compiler=NONE-Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,server=y,suspend=y,address=4001
-classpath
$CLASSPATH $FULL_PACKAGE

I set the breakpoint in my test case before connecting remotely with the
debugger and "Bob's your Uncle" we are away debugging (remotely).

I hope that this will be useful for others ...
Kind regards,
David.
